description:
area occupied in the seating plane of the geometrical object defined by its effective physical contour.
- The net area is defined as a plane normally not possible to be occupied by other geometrical objects |
 - The net area lies in the seating plane defined by the x/y- axes of the object and can be mathematically derived from the net space |
 - Seating plane is that plane on which the geometrical object is fixed.
